content:
THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS 8 O BROAD STREET NEW YORK 4, N. Y.
REPLY TO: FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, NEW YORK
April 27, 1962 File Ref. MSA-33.4
Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Dear Mr. Chang:
Under today's date is an allocation/request for concurrence letter, combined. This is a radical departure from the normal routine, which appeared to be necessary due to an apparent breakdown in channelling between requests for concurrence and the eventual issuance of purchase orders.
Any 1149 forms that have passed through my hands have been, or are being delivered as of today's date, to P/SP. 140.112.213.82
Inasmuch as the method used on this occasion is not dissimilar to the pattern which has been followed by AID/C on many past occasions, "Pick up first and cover with later issued Purchase Orders", therefore we can see no problem in finalizing these procurements.
Your Mr. Kan and Mr. Kiang have been briefed to some extent and inasmuch as our Miss Sze is to continue giving some assistance, no great problems will be encountered.
It has been a great pleasure, working with you and your associates and I am quite sad at the thought of leaving so many nice things and so many friends.
51.4. 28 08323 V.C.
SQ. 2
CUSA
439
L
SE
GEO/ks
cc : JHMoore, JGW
Yours very truly, THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION
4.2. Ott G. E. Otto Spec. Writer & Bid Analyst
國史馆 Academia Historica

REPLY TO: FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan

Under today's date is an allocation/request for concurrence letter, combined. This is a radical departure from the normal routine, which appeared to be necessary due to an apparent breakdown in channelling between requests for concurrence and the eventual issuance of purchase orders.
Any 1149 forms that have passed through my hands have been, or are being delivered as of today's date, to P/SP. 140.112.213.82

Inasmuch as the method used on this occasion is not dissimilar to the pattern which has been followed by AID/C on many past occasions, "Pick up first and cover with later issued Purchase Orders", therefore we can see no problem in finalizing these procurements.
Your Mr. Kan and Mr. Kiang have been briefed to some extent and inasmuch as our Miss Sze is to continue giving some assistance, no great problems will be encountered.
It has been a great pleasure, working with you and your associates and I am quite sad at the thought of leaving so many nice things and so many friends.
Yours very truly, THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION
4.2. Ott G. E. Otto Spec. Writer & Bid Analyst
